Detailed Description

Class that operates the vibrator on the device.

If your process exits, any vibration you started with will stop.

Check whether the hardware has a vibrator.

Returns:
True if the hardware has a vibrator, else false.
void gaia::system::Vibrator::vibrate ( const base::Vector< int64_t > &  pattern,
int32_t  repeat 
) const

Vibrate with a given pattern.

Pass in an array of ints that are the times at which to turn on or off the vibrator. The first one is how long to wait before turning it on, and then after that it alternates. If you want to repeat, pass the index into the pattern at which to start the repeat.

Parameters:
patternan array of longs of times to turn the vibrator on or off.
repeatthe index into pattern at which to repeat, or -1 if you don't want to repeat.
void gaia::system::Vibrator::vibrate ( int64_t  milliseconds) const

Turn the vibrator on.

Parameters:
millisecondsHow long to vibrate for.
